heading: Madhya Pradesh woman arrested for killing cousin over suspicion of affair with husband
summary: A 35-year-old woman allegedly hacked her cousin to death on suspicion that she was having affair with her husband. The incident took place at padhkar village, 45 km from the district headquarters, the police said.Roshani lost her cool when she saw Lalita talking on mobile phone.

heading: No one safe in UP?s jungle raj, says Priyanka Gandhi; Congress to launch e-campaign against crime
summary: The party launched an?e-campaign? through various social media platforms against the 'worsening law and order situation? in the state.

heading: Assam: Govt allows certain relaxations during lockdown in Guwahati, Kamrup
summary: The assam government has allowed certain relaxations during the ongoing lockdown in Kamrup (Metro) district, from July 5 to 12, chief secretary Kumar Sanjay Krishna said on Saturday. The district has reported 2,114 coronavirus cases in guwahati city since June 28 following a surge in the number of Covid-19 cases.

heading: Maha: Repayment of loans taken to make Ganpati idols worrying sculptors of Pen, stocks remain unsold
summary: There are 1.5 lakh idol-making factories in Pen taluka where more than 2 lakh people are employed around the year. The factories sell Ganpati idols at wholesale rates and sell them at a higher rate in other cities across the country. Immediately after the festivities, work on procuring material begins all over again for the next year's celebrations.

heading: As average daily Covid-19 cases come down, experts say Delhi may go past peak in August
summary: Experts warn that if social distancing and hygiene norms are not adhered to by people, then there could be a surge again. The national capital had reported the highest single-day spike of 3,947 cases per day in the past one week.

heading: Odisha Police seal hotel, arrest groom and kin for flouting COVID norms during wedding
summary: A surge in coronavirus cases in Odisha's Ganjam district is giving sleepless nights. The district administration sealed hotel Mayfair Gopalpur for hosting the wedding ceremony without adhering to the state government or the MHA guidelines. Five people, including the groom and his father along with three uncles, have been arrested.

heading: 2,505 fresh Covid-19 cases take Delhi's tally to over 97,000
summary: The death toll from coronavirus infection has risen to 3,004 and the total number of cases mounted to 97,200. On June 23, the national capital had reported the highest single-day spike of 3,947 cases.

heading: Heavy rains lash Maharashtra, north India reels under sultry weather
summary: India witnessed predominantly sultry weather, with Punjab and Haryana recording above-normal day temperatures. A 12 feet wall collapsed near Khetale Garden in Hajuri area, south of Raigad, recorded 52.6 mm rainfall during the period, while the Ratnagiri city weather station recorded 57.

heading: Noida: Man arrested for hacking into woman's Facebook account
summary: 25-year-old man arrested in Noida for allegedly posting on facebook a woman's pictures. He was identified as Kulvinder Singh, who works as sales executive at private firm in udham Singh Nagar, in Uttarakhand.

heading: Serie A: Cristiano Ronaldo scores from free kick, Buffon breaks record in Juventus win
summary: Cristiano Ronaldo scores from a free kick for Juventus. Goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon makes record 648th Serie A appearance for the league leaders as they beat smaller neighbours Torino 4-1 in the Derby della Mole on sunday.

heading: Kerala: Elephant dies of injuries, officials say may have eaten cracker-laden fruit
summary: Five-year-old elephant found weak a day ago with fractured jaw . It died last night at attappadi in Palakkad, hardly a month after pachyderm's death . Forest officials suspect the elephant could have bitten into a cracker filled coconut or some fruit . The elephant is suspected to have strayed from neighbouring Tamil Nadu forests as it had not been spotted earlier in any herds by forest officials so far, official said . On may 27, a . .s

heading: WHO halts hydroxychloroquine, HIV drugs in Covid trials after failure to reduce deaths
summary: Hydroxychloroquine and lopinavir/ritonavir produce little or no reduction in mortality . Solidarity trial investigators will interrupt the trials with immediate effect, the WHO says . Decision does not affect other studies where the drugs are used for non-hospitalised patients or as prophylaxis . Who sees first results from coronavirus drug trials within two weeksWATCH | Anti-malaria drug hydroxychroloroquiine?s trials to resume, says WHO .

heading: Assam flood situation improves, 10.75 lakh people still affected, death toll rises to 37
summary: The flood situation in Assam is gradually improving as the water level of all major rivers is decreasing . But over 10.75 lakh people of 18 districts are still affected due to the current floods . Clear skies over the past three days have brought some relief to the people of assam . However, two people drowned in floodwaters in Morigaon and Tinsukia district on Friday, taking the death toll to 37 . A total of 6,531 people have taken shelter at 171 relief camps set n -

heading: Let us code for Aatmanirbhar Bharat! PM invites techies to take part in App Innovation Challenge
summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday urged India's tech community to participate in the 'Aatmanirbhar Bharat App Innovation Challenge' the announcement was made by the PM in a post on LinkedIn where he mentioned that india's vibrant tech and start-up ecosystem has excelled because of the enthusiasm of youngsters who are developing and promoting homegrown apps . The government of india will mentor and support existing apps that can be classified in the categories of e-learning, work-from-home, gaming . ..

heading: Covid-19 patient kept in ambulance for one day for want of bed
summary: 64-year-old man succumbed to coronavirus infection in neighbouring Navi Mumbai . He had to be kept in an ambulance for a whole day before he could be admitted to a hospital . Family did not have the money to buy an injection that cost Rs 32,000 . The man, who performed in a music band, died on June 25"he developed coughing and breathing problem on June 20. We took him to the Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation''s (NMMC) Covid hospital at Vnn -

heading: Kerala: Thiruvananthapuram on alert after Zomato delivery boy tests positive for Covid-19
summary: State capital Thiruvananthapuram is also on high vigil after 240 Covid-19 cases on Saturday . A Zomato delivery executive, a medical representative and a police officer have tested positive . The state has so far reported 25 deaths due to the virus . Coronavirus: Kerala shows the way forward and shows how to deal with it - ALSO READ | How Kerala kept its migrants happyALSO WATCH | Tackling the coronal virus: Kerala: triple lockdown in parts

heading: Interested to see how players will be handed out points on basis of reduced US Open: Leander Paes
summary: Tennis star leander paes says he is happy to see sports taking the tiniest of steps towards normalcy . He feels it is the right time for resumption of sports with some social distancing . Sports events like Bundesliga, La Liga and Premier League returned last month after a long hiatus . The ATP and WTA tours are due to return next month, with the US open starting on august 31 . Paes: "these babysteps are a

heading: Bengal: TMC leader killed in Birbhum, party councilor shot at in North 24 Parganas
summary: A TMC leader was shot dead in west Bengal's Birbhum district . Police recovered the body of the leader on saturday . A councillor received bullet injuries after miscreants fired at her during a picnic . The incident has led to panic in the area, a local resident says . It is not clear if Das was the main target, but whoever fired must be arrested, police say . In a separate incident, an outgoing councillor was shot in her leg by miscre

heading: Jamie Vardy nets 100th Premier League goal as Leicester City beat Crystal Palace 3-0
summary: Jamie Vardy nets his 100th premier league goal as Leicester City beat crystal palace 3-0 . The result means Leicester remain third in the table, eight points behind manchester city . Crystal palace are 13th on 42 points, while Leicester are third on 43 points . Chelsea have won three of their last five games, while manchester united have won just one . Man united's aaron ramsey scored his first goal of the season in a 2-0 win over swans -

heading: Premier League: Mason Greenwood equals Wayne Rooney?s record as Manchester United crush Bournemouth
summary: Manchester united beat Bournemouth 5-2 in the premier league on saturday . Anthony martial, Marcus Rashford and Bruno Fernandes scored for united . United move into fourth place on 55 points from 33 games, one more than Chelsea who were at home to Watford in the 1900 GMT kickoff . Alan pardew's side have now lost 17 of their last 22 league games . Click here for all the latest premier league news . Read: manchester united v ..

heading: What happened to George Floyd was disgusting, need to realise responsibility of power: Leander Paes
summary: Leander paes says he felt disgusted after seeing the video of a white police officer kneeling on a black man's neck . The incident has led to massive outrage across the globe . "i have faced it subtly, a few times," he says . He has announced that he will bring the curtains down on his illustrious career in 2020, but has faced racism on certain occasions, he adds he doesn't have the personality to do it .

heading: TMC worker killed, SUCI member found hanging as clashes break out in Bengal's Kultali
summary: Workers of the SUCI and the ruling TMC clashed over a power tussle, sources say . The TMC alleged that its member Ashwini Manna was beaten up and hacked to death . A district committee member's body was found hanging from a tree in the area, police said . Eleven persons have been arrested in connection with the clashes, officials said. Three more have been detained, adding that they have been deployed to tackle the situation. Several members of

heading: Neha Dhupia on gaining 23 kg post pregnancy: Mujhe laga meri naukri chali jayegi
summary: Neha Dhupia was interacting with a contestant where she opened up on putting on 23 kg after pregnancy. She feared that she would lose her job and would not get opportunities in future, she says 'roadies took me no matter what'

heading: Hindustan Unilever renames skin lightening cream to Glow & Lovely
summary: Hindustan Unilever says its skin cream fair & Lovely will be rebranded. It has drawn flak for promoting negative stereotypes related to darker skin tones.

heading: To promise victory against a great team like Qatar would be suicidal: India coach Igor Stimac
summary: India's draw against Asian champions Qatar in a world cup qualifier last year was one of their best results. Coach Igor Stimac does not want to put pressure on his players by promising victory in the return leg against the sao paulos team in Bhubaneswar on October 8 and Bangladesh on November 12 and Kolkata on novembre 17

heading: Netizens flood PM Modi's Instagram account with bizarre comments after TikTok ban
summary: Netizens spam old posts of PM Modi on Instagram, and left a barrage of comments on them. Some of the comments left under the post were really nasty, some users also penned lyrics of some songs.

heading: Arvind Kejriwal inaugurates plasma bank, asks people to donate plasma to save Covid-19 patients
summary: A plasma bank to treat novel coronavirus started functioning in Delhi on friday. The chief minister said the eligibility for being an plasma donor is "very strict" the government has set up the 'plasma bank' and urged those who have recovered from the virus to donate plasma to other patients.

heading: Sensex, Nifty scale four-month high as rupee surges against USD
summary: The rupee ended at 75.01 against the dollar, its best closing level since march 27. The number of Covid-19 cases in India crossed 600,000, with the death toll touching 17,834, days after the government allowed more economic activities to resume. India's benchmark stock indexes are down around 13 per cent for the year so far, even after a

heading: No fans at La Liga stadiums for rest of the season, say organisers
summary: Spain's secretary for sport says fans should be allowed back once it is safe to do so. The league drew up a draft protocol in the event that the government approved their return.

heading: Harsh Goenka visits restaurant after 3 months, shares pic of menu and dishes. But there's a catch
summary: The restaurant that the industrialist visited was actually a dining experience created by his children. The post quickly managed to garner over 1.2k likes, and netizens also took to the comments section to praise the kids and their efforts.
